cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 55 miles W of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest, forecast to turn north then north-northeast across the eastern Gulf and up the U.S. East Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north Florida Gulf Coast (Big Bend area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and tropical-storm watches confined to the Florida Big Bend northward to South Carolina (well west and north of the Virgin Islands)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm-surge and tropical-storm warnings along the Florida Keys and west coast of Florida (well west of the Virgin Islands)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, southeastern U.S. coast up to the Mid-Atlantic and New England
weather_observation.expected_closest_date_to_port: 2021-07-02 (storm already passed south of the Virgin Islands last week)
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None listed – wind-probability table does not include any Caribbean locations
weather_observation.wind: No hazardous winds expected at St. Croix – Elsa is hundreds of miles to the northwest and moving farther away
